intro: Galium segetum, commonly known as field bedstraw, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming from June to August. Its fruits are small, dry, and three-angled, containing minute seeds. Galium segetum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
